texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: RATIONALIZATION OF TEACHERS' WORKLOAD IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS AND PAYMENT OF TEACHING OVERLOAD
texts.text: RATIONALIZATION OF TEACHERS' WORKLOAD IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS AND PAYMENT OF TEACHING OVERLOAD

texts.label: text
texts.orig: To:
texts.text: To:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Undersecretaries Assistant Secretaries Bureau and Service Directors Regional Directors Schools Division Superintendents Public Elementary and Secondary School Heads Public Elementary and Secondary School Teachers All Others Concerned
texts.text: Undersecretaries Assistant Secretaries Bureau and Service Directors Regional Directors Schools Division Superintendents Public Elementary and Secondary School Heads Public Elementary and Secondary School Teachers All Others Concerned

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 The Department of Education (DepEd) issues the enclosed policy guidelines on the Rationalization of Teachers' Workload in Public Schools and Payment of Teaching Overload, pursuant to Republic Act (RA) No. 4670 dated June 18, 1966, or the Magna Carta for Public School Teachers, and the Civil Service Commission Resolution No. 080096 dated January 28, 2008
texts.text: 1 The Department of Education (DepEd) issues the enclosed policy guidelines on the Rationalization of Teachers' Workload in Public Schools and Payment of Teaching Overload, pursuant to Republic Act (RA) No. 4670 dated June 18, 1966, or the Magna Carta for Public School Teachers, and the Civil Service Commission Resolution No. 080096 dated January 28, 2008

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2 This DepEd Order (DO) is guided by agency directions that are geared toward building a conducive environment for effective teaching and learning to thrive.
texts.text: 2 This DepEd Order (DO) is guided by agency directions that are geared toward building a conducive environment for effective teaching and learning to thrive.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Teachers shall render eight hours of service per of which six hours shall be devoted to actual classroom teaching: day ,
texts.text: Teachers shall render eight hours of service per of which six hours shall be devoted to actual classroom teaching: day ,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. The remaining two hours shall be allotted for work incidental to the normal teaching duties which may be spent within or outside the school premises.
texts.text: The remaining two hours shall be allotted for work incidental to the normal teaching duties which may be spent within or outside the school premises.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C Other teaching-related work; such as but not limited to being a school coordinator, shall be duly compensated in accordance with Section 14 of RA 4670
texts.text: C Other teaching-related work; such as but not limited to being a school coordinator, shall be duly compensated in accordance with Section 14 of RA 4670

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d In exigency of service, actual classroom teaching in excess of the required six hours shall be   compensated through payment of teaching overload, provided that it does not exceed two hours per day.
texts.text: d In exigency of service, actual classroom teaching in excess of the required six hours shall be   compensated through payment of teaching overload, provided that it does not exceed two hours per day.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3 The mechanisms, procedures, and standards stipulated herein shall all DepEd offices and schools, including the heads of offices, school heads, and teachers on the rationalization of teachers' workload in public schools, along with providing   appropriate compensation and benefits to teachers who exceed prescribed workload or working hours. guide
texts.text: 3 The mechanisms, procedures, and standards stipulated herein shall all DepEd offices and schools, including the heads of offices, school heads, and teachers on the rationalization of teachers' workload in public schools, along with providing   appropriate compensation and benefits to teachers who exceed prescribed workload or working hours. guide

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: RATIONALIZATION OF TEACHERS' WORKLOAD IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS AND PAYMENT OF TEACHING OVERLOAD
texts.text: RATIONALIZATION OF TEACHERS' WORKLOAD IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS AND PAYMENT OF TEACHING OVERLOAD

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: I RATIONALE
texts.text: I RATIONALE

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Department of Education (DepEd) strives to cultivate a work environment that ensures quality   teaching workforce. In support of this thrust, the Department institutionalized the Philippine Professional Standards for Teachers (PPST) to guide all teachers in public schools and clearly set expectations on teacher performance, attainment of proficiency, and professional development.
texts.text: The Department of Education (DepEd) strives to cultivate a work environment that ensures quality   teaching workforce. In support of this thrust, the Department institutionalized the Philippine Professional Standards for Teachers (PPST) to guide all teachers in public schools and clearly set expectations on teacher performance, attainment of proficiency, and professional development.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: However, DepEd acknowledges that teacher welfare is as important as teacher quality . Guided by the Republic Act (RA) No. 4670 or the Magna Carta for Public School Teachers, the holistic well-being of teachers is prioritized by ensuring fair and equitable distribution of teacher workload.
texts.text: However, DepEd acknowledges that teacher welfare is as important as teacher quality . Guided by the Republic Act (RA) No. 4670 or the Magna Carta for Public School Teachers, the holistic well-being of teachers is prioritized by ensuring fair and equitable distribution of teacher workload.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Section 13 of the Magna Carta affirms that actual classroom teaching hours shall not be more than six (6) hours a except in exigencies of service where teachers may render more than six (6) hours but not exceeding eight (8) hours of actual classroom teaching a day. Consequently, any actual teaching performed beyond six (6) hours, as well as any other activities outside their normal teaching duties as stipulated in Section 14, shall be compensated accordingly. day
texts.text: Section 13 of the Magna Carta affirms that actual classroom teaching hours shall not be more than six (6) hours a except in exigencies of service where teachers may render more than six (6) hours but not exceeding eight (8) hours of actual classroom teaching a day. Consequently, any actual teaching performed beyond six (6) hours, as well as any other activities outside their normal teaching duties as stipulated in Section 14, shall be compensated accordingly. day

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In response to the precepts of the Magna Carta, several Department issuances were released to provide implementing guidelines on the working hours of public school teachers. DECS Order No. 039, 1990, Deployment and Assignment of Public School Teachers, reiterated the provision of RA 4670 on the actual teaching hours. The said Order has also assigned teaching load to other tasks like class advising duties and coaching, as well as handling of special /remedial classes.
texts.text: In response to the precepts of the Magna Carta, several Department issuances were released to provide implementing guidelines on the working hours of public school teachers. DECS Order No. 039, 1990, Deployment and Assignment of Public School Teachers, reiterated the provision of RA 4670 on the actual teaching hours. The said Order has also assigned teaching load to other tasks like class advising duties and coaching, as well as handling of special /remedial classes.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: With guidance from the Civil Service Commission (CSC), the Department also released DepEd Memorandum (DM) No 291, 2008, Guidelines for the Implementation of CSC Resolution No. 080096 on Working Hours for Public School Teachers, and DepEd Order (DO) No. 016, 2009, Addendum to DepEd Memorandum No.  291, 2008, which further clarified school teachers; as government employees, are not exempted from the eight-hour work of which six (6) hours shall be allotted to actual classroom teaching and the two (2) hours shall be engaged to tasks incidental to the teaching-learning process. day,
texts.text: With guidance from the Civil Service Commission (CSC), the Department also released DepEd Memorandum (DM) No 291, 2008, Guidelines for the Implementation of CSC Resolution No. 080096 on Working Hours for Public School Teachers, and DepEd Order (DO) No. 016, 2009, Addendum to DepEd Memorandum No.  291, 2008, which further clarified school teachers; as government employees, are not exempted from the eight-hour work of which six (6) hours shall be allotted to actual classroom teaching and the two (2) hours shall be engaged to tasks incidental to the teaching-learning process. day,

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Despite the issuance of the aforementioned guidelines, various interpretations remain and are still rampant due to the absence of clear operational definition of governing principles, implementing arrangements across governance   levels, parameters in determining workload and overload, and monitoring and evaluation mechanisms and procedures.
texts.text: Despite the issuance of the aforementioned guidelines, various interpretations remain and are still rampant due to the absence of clear operational definition of governing principles, implementing arrangements across governance   levels, parameters in determining workload and overload, and monitoring and evaluation mechanisms and procedures.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Through this Order, the Department aims to maximize teachers' time spent on actual classroom teaching and related duties,   enabling them to focus on improving the teaching and learning processes that occur within classrooms. This policy is designed enhance  teacher quality, promote teacher welfare, and ultimately, contribute to improved learning outcomes.
texts.text: Through this Order, the Department aims to maximize teachers' time spent on actual classroom teaching and related duties,   enabling them to focus on improving the teaching and learning processes that occur within classrooms. This policy is designed enhance  teacher quality, promote teacher welfare, and ultimately, contribute to improved learning outcomes.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Page 1 of 13
texts.text: Page 1 of 13

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: II SCOPE
texts.text: II SCOPE

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This DepEd Order provides guidelines on the rationalization of teachers' workload in public schools and streamlines teachers' other tasks by specifying allowed teaching-related assignments.
texts.text: This DepEd Order provides guidelines on the rationalization of teachers' workload in public schools and streamlines teachers' other tasks by specifying allowed teaching-related assignments.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This Order covers all DepEd-employed teachers engaged in classroom teaching; on a full-time basis, under permanent, provisional, or substitute status in all public elementary and secondary schools.
texts.text: This Order covers all DepEd-employed teachers engaged in classroom teaching; on a full-time basis, under permanent, provisional, or substitute status in all public elementary and secondary schools.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Furthermore, this policy shall be implemented across all governance levels. The guidelines, parameters; and processes outlined herein shall guide DepEd schools, Schools Division Offices (SDOs), Regional Offices (ROs), and Central Office (CO) in the distribution of teacher workload, streamlining of teaching-related tasks, as computation and compensation of teaching overload and accumulation of vacation with existing laws, rules, and well as service credits   (VSC), in accordance regulations.
texts.text: Furthermore, this policy shall be implemented across all governance levels. The guidelines, parameters; and processes outlined herein shall guide DepEd schools, Schools Division Offices (SDOs), Regional Offices (ROs), and Central Office (CO) in the distribution of teacher workload, streamlining of teaching-related tasks, as computation and compensation of teaching overload and accumulation of vacation with existing laws, rules, and well as service credits   (VSC), in accordance regulations.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: III. DEFINITION OF TERMS
texts.text: III. DEFINITION OF TERMS

texts.label: text
texts.orig: For this purpose, the following terms shall be defined as follows:
texts.text: For this purpose, the following terms shall be defined as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Class Advising Duties refer to ancillary tasks performed by a class adviser
texts.text: Class Advising Duties refer to ancillary tasks performed by a class adviser

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: to manage a class or group of learners for a certain grade level.
texts.text: to manage a class or group of learners for a certain grade level.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b Classroom refers to any learning space whether physical, virtual, or other alternative   spaces in communities or households  used for teaching and learning engagements through various learning delivery modalities.
texts.text: b Classroom refers to any learning space whether physical, virtual, or other alternative   spaces in communities or households  used for teaching and learning engagements through various learning delivery modalities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Compensation refers to monetary payment to teachers for services rendered.
texts.text: Compensation refers to monetary payment to teachers for services rendered.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: This includes salary and wages, or additional incentives attached to work rendered for their position.
texts.text: This includes salary and wages, or additional incentives attached to work rendered for their position.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. Remediation refers to the instructional program designed to support struggling learners who have not developed or attained expected curricular competencies and help them strengthen their basic skills to succeed in school. It shall be an after-school program with dedicated time, an organized class, and support to learners.
texts.text: Remediation refers to the instructional program designed to support struggling learners who have not developed or attained expected curricular competencies and help them strengthen their basic skills to succeed in school. It shall be an after-school program with dedicated time, an organized class, and support to learners.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e. School Headsl refer to persons responsible for the administrative and instructional supervision of the school or cluster of schools as provided for in RA No. 9155. For the purpose of this policy, a duly designated Teacher-inCharge (TIC) is considered a School Head.
texts.text: School Headsl refer to persons responsible for the administrative and instructional supervision of the school or cluster of schools as provided for in RA No. 9155. For the purpose of this policy, a duly designated Teacher-inCharge (TIC) is considered a School Head.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Teacher Ancillary Tasks refer to work incidental to the teachers' normal
texts.text: Teacher Ancillary Tasks refer to work incidental to the teachers' normal

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: f teaching duties.
texts.text: f teaching duties.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: g. Teacher Shortage refers to the deficiency in the number of teachers in a school. Teacher shortage is derived from the latest enrollment data and teacher inventory data from the Basic Education Information System (BEIS)
texts.text: Teacher Shortage refers to the deficiency in the number of teachers in a school. Teacher shortage is derived from the latest enrollment data and teacher inventory data from the Basic Education Information System (BEIS)

texts.label: footnote
texts.orig: Republic Act No. 9155 or the Governance of Basic Education Act of 2001
texts.text: Republic Act No. 9155 or the Governance of Basic Education Act of 2001

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Page 2 of 13
texts.text: Page 2 of 13

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: h Teachers refer to those occupying teaching positions directly engaged in teaching or delivery of instruction in the elementary and secondary levels (junior high school and senior high school) in schools and Community Learning Centers (CLCs) .
texts.text: h Teachers refer to those occupying teaching positions directly engaged in teaching or delivery of instruction in the elementary and secondary levels (junior high school and senior high school) in schools and Community Learning Centers (CLCs) .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 Teaching Load refers to the actual classroom teaching hours or minutes rendered by a teacher.
texts.text: 1 Teaching Load refers to the actual classroom teaching hours or minutes rendered by a teacher.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: j. Teaching Overload refers to the actual classroom teaching in excess of the prescribed six (6) hours of actual classroom teaching in a The teaching overload shall not exceed two (2) hours a or ten (10) hours a week. day . day
texts.text: Teaching Overload refers to the actual classroom teaching in excess of the prescribed six (6) hours of actual classroom teaching in a The teaching overload shall not exceed two (2) hours a or ten (10) hours a week. day . day

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: k Teaching Overload refers to the additional compensation of public school teachers who render actual classroom teaching beyond the required thirty (30) hours a week. The compensation shall be at least twenty-five percent (25%) of a teacher's regular remuneration. Pay
texts.text: k Teaching Overload refers to the additional compensation of public school teachers who render actual classroom teaching beyond the required thirty (30) hours a week. The compensation shall be at least twenty-five percent (25%) of a teacher's regular remuneration. Pay

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Teaching-related assignments refer to tasks related to teaching and academic learning which support learner development. These tasks are performed teachers in consideration of their professional expertise and experience. by
texts.text: Teaching-related assignments refer to tasks related to teaching and academic learning which support learner development. These tasks are performed teachers in consideration of their professional expertise and experience. by

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: m_ Vacation Service Credits (VSC) refer to the leave credits earned by public school teachers for services rendered during activities authorized by proper authorities during periods with no classes (e.g-, semestral breaks and official non-working holidays). These credits are used to offset their absences due to illness, or to offset proportional deductions in vacation salary due to absences for personal reasons or late appointment. For purposes of this Order, VSC can be granted for teaching overload and activities during the regular school year as authorized by this Order. long
texts.text: m_ Vacation Service Credits (VSC) refer to the leave credits earned by public school teachers for services rendered during activities authorized by proper authorities during periods with no classes (e.g-, semestral breaks and official non-working holidays). These credits are used to offset their absences due to illness, or to offset proportional deductions in vacation salary due to absences for personal reasons or late appointment. For purposes of this Order, VSC can be granted for teaching overload and activities during the regular school year as authorized by this Order. long

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: IV POLICY STATEMENT
texts.text: IV POLICY STATEMENT

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This DepEd Order aims to enable teachers to focus on their core function of teaching by establishing a more conducive work environment. This goal shall be achieved through a fair and equitable distribution of teaching workload and implementation of a streamlined set of teacher ancillary tasks and teachingrelated assignments. The process for the payment of teaching overload and the accumulation of VSC is provided as guidance for all concerned personnel and offices
texts.text: This DepEd Order aims to enable teachers to focus on their core function of teaching by establishing a more conducive work environment. This goal shall be achieved through a fair and equitable distribution of teaching workload and implementation of a streamlined set of teacher ancillary tasks and teachingrelated assignments. The process for the payment of teaching overload and the accumulation of VSC is provided as guidance for all concerned personnel and offices

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Consistent with the Departments commitment to give support to teachers; this Order fosters a work environment where teachers are focused on their role as learning facilitators. When teachers are engaged in actual classroom teaching and their teaching hours are protected, quality teaching is realized, resulting in quality learning: Therefore, the quality teaching and learning experience shall contribute to improved learning outcomes.
texts.text: Consistent with the Departments commitment to give support to teachers; this Order fosters a work environment where teachers are focused on their role as learning facilitators. When teachers are engaged in actual classroom teaching and their teaching hours are protected, quality teaching is realized, resulting in quality learning: Therefore, the quality teaching and learning experience shall contribute to improved learning outcomes.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Page 3 of 13
texts.text: Page 3 of 13

texts.orig: V GUIDELINES AND PROCEDURES
texts.text: V GUIDELINES AND PROCEDURES

texts.orig: Streamlining Teaching Workload

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. A public school teacher shall render eight (8) hours of work per of which six (6) hours shall be devoted to actual classroom teaching and two (2) hours shall be allocated for teacher ancillary tasks which may day ,
texts.text: A public school teacher shall render eight (8) hours of work per of which six (6) hours shall be devoted to actual classroom teaching and two (2) hours shall be allocated for teacher ancillary tasks which may day ,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: be spent within or outside school premises.
texts.text: be spent within or outside school premises.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: No teacher shall be required to submit documentary evidence or accomplishment reports on how the two (2) hours of ancillary tasks are spent outside school premises.
texts.text: No teacher shall be required to submit documentary evidence or accomplishment reports on how the two (2) hours of ancillary tasks are spent outside school premises.

texts.orig: a teacher must be able to render thirty (30) hours of actual
texts.text: a teacher must be able to render thirty (30) hours of actual

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2 In a week, classroom teaching and ten (10) hours of teacher ancillary tasks.
texts.text: 2 In a week, classroom teaching and ten (10) hours of teacher ancillary tasks.

texts.orig: A.l Teaching Load
texts.text: A.l Teaching Load

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. In completing the six (6) hours per Or thirty (30) hours per week devoted to actual classroom teaching, any of the following parameters shall be observed: day
texts.text: In completing the six (6) hours per Or thirty (30) hours per week devoted to actual classroom teaching, any of the following parameters shall be observed: day

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: a Teachers
texts.text: a Teachers

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: and the two (2) hours shall be allotted to teacher ancillary tasks incidental to the teacher's normal teaching duties defined under
texts.text: and the two (2) hours shall be allotted to teacher ancillary tasks incidental to the teacher's normal teaching duties defined under

texts.orig: i Teachers shall render six (6) hours of actual classroom teaching
texts.text: i Teachers shall render six (6) hours of actual classroom teaching

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: b Master Teachers (MT)
texts.text: b Master Teachers (MT)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ii. In cases where Master Teachers are designated as class advisers, this task shall form part of the six hours of actual classroom teaching:
texts.text: In cases where Master Teachers are designated as class advisers, this task shall form part of the six hours of actual classroom teaching:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 Master Teachers shall likewise render six (6) hours of actual classroom teaching and the two (2) hours shall be allotted to teacher ancillary tasks incidental to the teacher's normal teaching duties defined under item V.A.3 of this Order.
texts.text: 1 Master Teachers shall likewise render six (6) hours of actual classroom teaching and the two (2) hours shall be allotted to teacher ancillary tasks incidental to the teacher's normal teaching duties defined under item V.A.3 of this Order.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iii. In line with the function of Master Teachers as defined in the PPST, coaching; mentoring; and provision of technical assistance to colleagues shall be treated as an ancillary task and shall be compensated with VSC if performed beyond the 8-hour workday, following the procedures provided herein.
texts.text: In line with the function of Master Teachers as defined in the PPST, coaching; mentoring; and provision of technical assistance to colleagues shall be treated as an ancillary task and shall be compensated with VSC if performed beyond the 8-hour workday, following the procedures provided herein.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2 Class advising duties, as part of the ancillary tasks of teachers; shall be
texts.text: 2 Class advising duties, as part of the ancillary tasks of teachers; shall be

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: treated as teaching load equivalent to one (1) hour per or five (5) hours a week. Included in the five (5) hours is the prescribed time for the Homeroom Guidance Program (HGP). day
texts.text: treated as teaching load equivalent to one (1) hour per or five (5) hours a week. Included in the five (5) hours is the prescribed time for the Homeroom Guidance Program (HGP). day

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Remediation and/or enhancement classes shall likewise be treated as a teaching load. The allotted time and other procedural guidelines shall be in accordance with other DepEd issuances.
texts.text: Remediation and/or enhancement classes shall likewise be treated as a teaching load. The allotted time and other procedural guidelines shall be in accordance with other DepEd issuances.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Page 4 of 13
texts.text: Page 4 of 13

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4 Program-based strategy, approach, or intervention intended to strengthen the skills and competencies of learners conducted during the allotted time per learning area shall not account for an additional teaching load.
texts.text: 4 Program-based strategy, approach, or intervention intended to strengthen the skills and competencies of learners conducted during the allotted time per learning area shall not account for an additional teaching load.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5 Teachers designated as Teacher-in-Charge (TIC) are considered school heads. The designation of TIC shall be supported by a duly signed designation order from the Schools Division Superintendent (SDS) specifying duties and functions, authority, accountability, and responsibility, among others. Hence, TICs shall be relieved of teaching and other  related duties and perform fully the function of a school head. However, in the exigency of service; TICs may be given teaching loads on the condition that all teachers in the school have been   assigned the maximum teaching overload of two (2) hours. The teaching load of TICs shall form part of their regular work hours. As a result; any work performed beyond the regular work hours shall be compensated accordingly .
texts.text: 5 Teachers designated as Teacher-in-Charge (TIC) are considered school heads. The designation of TIC shall be supported by a duly signed designation order from the Schools Division Superintendent (SDS) specifying duties and functions, authority, accountability, and responsibility, among others. Hence, TICs shall be relieved of teaching and other  related duties and perform fully the function of a school head. However, in the exigency of service; TICs may be given teaching loads on the condition that all teachers in the school have been   assigned the maximum teaching overload of two (2) hours. The teaching load of TICs shall form part of their regular work hours. As a result; any work performed beyond the regular work hours shall be compensated accordingly .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6 The Alternative Learning System   (ALS) and Special Needs Education (SNED) teachers shall likewise observe the prescribed work hours for teachers.
texts.text: 6 The Alternative Learning System   (ALS) and Special Needs Education (SNED) teachers shall likewise observe the prescribed work hours for teachers.

texts.orig: The School Heads shall ensure that teaching load is equitably and fairly

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: A.2 Teaching Overload
texts.text: A.2 Teaching Overload

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 Hours rendered as actual classroom teaching in excess of the prescribed six (6) hours in a for teachers shall be counted as teaching overload. The number of minutes accumulated on a weekly basis shall be converted day
texts.text: 1 Hours rendered as actual classroom teaching in excess of the prescribed six (6) hours in a for teachers shall be counted as teaching overload. The number of minutes accumulated on a weekly basis shall be converted day

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: into hours for the computation of appropriate teaching overload pay.
texts.text: into hours for the computation of appropriate teaching overload pay.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. To ensure the general welfare of teaching personnel, the maximum hours of teaching overload per day is two (2) hours as provided under Section 13 No. 4670, and Chapter 6 of the Department of  Budget and Management (DBM) Manual on Position Classification and Compensation
texts.text: To ensure the general welfare of teaching personnel, the maximum hours of teaching overload per day is two (2) hours as provided under Section 13 No. 4670, and Chapter 6 of the Department of  Budget and Management (DBM) Manual on Position Classification and Compensation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. As a general rule, only teachers in schools with teacher shortage based on the enhanced planning parameters are eligible for teaching overload pay. However, tasks requiring actual classroom teaching duties whether inperson;, distance, or blended, including relieving duties for other teachers, which are beyond the normal teaching hours and affecting vacant periods shall also be considered   teaching overload, provided it satisfies the conditions in Items A.2.1 and A.2.2, respectively.
texts.text: As a general rule, only teachers in schools with teacher shortage based on the enhanced planning parameters are eligible for teaching overload pay. However, tasks requiring actual classroom teaching duties whether inperson;, distance, or blended, including relieving duties for other teachers, which are beyond the normal teaching hours and affecting vacant periods shall also be considered   teaching overload, provided it satisfies the conditions in Items A.2.1 and A.2.2, respectively.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4 All teachers shall render the prescribed number of actual classroom teaching hours before may be assigned a teaching overload. The specialization of teachers must be a consideration for the school head in assigning overload. they prime
texts.text: 4 All teachers shall render the prescribed number of actual classroom teaching hours before may be assigned a teaching overload. The specialization of teachers must be a consideration for the school head in assigning overload. they prime

texts.text: B. Administration of Compensation and Benefits

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: B.1 Payment of Teaching Overload
texts.text: B.1 Payment of Teaching Overload

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 Teaching overload shall be compensated through teaching overload pay.
texts.text: 1 Teaching overload shall be compensated through teaching overload pay.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The School Head shall prepare a record of teachers who rendered services beyond six (6) hours aggregated on a weekly basis.
texts.text: The School Head shall prepare a record of teachers who rendered services beyond six (6) hours aggregated on a weekly basis.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3 Payment of teaching overload shall be made on a quarterly basis, subject to the extent of allotment for the purpose. In the event of insufficiency of funds, teaching overload hours shall be converted to earned VSC provided under existing DepEd policy .
texts.text: 3 Payment of teaching overload shall be made on a quarterly basis, subject to the extent of allotment for the purpose. In the event of insufficiency of funds, teaching overload hours shall be converted to earned VSC provided under existing DepEd policy .

texts.label: section_header

texts.text: B.2 Grant of Vacation Service Credits

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Teacher ancillary tasks defined in V.A.3.5, V.A.3.6, and teachingrelated assignments performed by teachers beyond regular work hours shall be compensated through the grant of VSC.
texts.text: Teacher ancillary tasks defined in V.A.3.5, V.A.3.6, and teachingrelated assignments performed by teachers beyond regular work hours shall be compensated through the grant of VSC.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Eight (8) hours of services rendered shall be equivalent to at least 1.25 VSC.
texts.text: Eight (8) hours of services rendered shall be equivalent to at least 1.25 VSC.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: E. Grievance Mechanism
texts.text: E. Grievance Mechanism

texts.label: text
texts.orig: this policy shall be addressed through the grievance machinery provided under DO No. 35, s. 20042 or pertinent rules on administrative cases in the civil service.
texts.text: this policy shall be addressed through the grievance machinery provided under DO No. 35, s. 20042 or pertinent rules on administrative cases in the civil service.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: VI. MONITORING AND EVALUATION
texts.text: VI. MONITORING AND EVALUATION

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The DepEd, through the BHROD, shall   monitor, evaluate, and review the implementation of this policy, consistent with the policy development process of the Department. Furthermore, BHROD-SED shall gather feedback on the implementation of these guidelines from concerned personnel acrossdifferent governance levels.
texts.text: The DepEd, through the BHROD, shall   monitor, evaluate, and review the implementation of this policy, consistent with the policy development process of the Department. Furthermore, BHROD-SED shall gather feedback on the implementation of these guidelines from concerned personnel acrossdifferent governance levels.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Anchored on the principles of decentralization and shared governance, the Department aims to empower the field offices in terms of monitoring and evaluating policy implementation and providing technical assistance.
texts.text: Anchored on the principles of decentralization and shared governance, the Department aims to empower the field offices in terms of monitoring and evaluating policy implementation and providing technical assistance.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: VII. REPEALING CLAUSE
texts.text: VII. REPEALING CLAUSE

texts.label: text
texts.orig: All other DepEd Orders, Memoranda, and related issuances, rules and regulations, and provisions which are inconsistent with this Order are hereby rescinded or modified accordingly .
texts.text: All other DepEd Orders, Memoranda, and related issuances, rules and regulations, and provisions which are inconsistent with this Order are hereby rescinded or modified accordingly .

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: SEPARABILITY CLAUSE
texts.text: SEPARABILITY CLAUSE

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If any provision of this Order is declared invalid or unenforceable by competent authority or the Courts, all other provisions not affected shall remain in force and in effect.
texts.text: If any provision of this Order is declared invalid or unenforceable by competent authority or the Courts, all other provisions not affected shall remain in force and in effect.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: TRANSITORY PROVISION
texts.text: TRANSITORY PROVISION

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Relative to the pilot implementation of the ALS-Senior High School (ALS-SHS) , this policy allows the granting of teaching overload pay to eligible teachers in identified pilot schools subject to the provisions indicated herein. An official list of pilot schools shall be released in a separate DepEd issuance for said purpose.
texts.text: Relative to the pilot implementation of the ALS-Senior High School (ALS-SHS) , this policy allows the granting of teaching overload pay to eligible teachers in identified pilot schools subject to the provisions indicated herein. An official list of pilot schools shall be released in a separate DepEd issuance for said purpose.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This arrangement shall be deemed temporary until such time dedicated full-time ALS teachers are allotted and deployed for SHS.
texts.text: This arrangement shall be deemed temporary until such time dedicated full-time ALS teachers are allotted and deployed for SHS.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In view of the curriculum reform and development; provisions that may be found inconsistent with its implementation shall be subject to further review.
texts.text: In view of the curriculum reform and development; provisions that may be found inconsistent with its implementation shall be subject to further review.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: X EFFECTIVITY
texts.text: X EFFECTIVITY

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This DepEd Order shall take effect immediately upon its approval; issuance, and publication on its website. Certified of this Order shall be registered with the Office of the National Administrative Register (ONAR) at the University of the copies
texts.text: This DepEd Order shall take effect immediately upon its approval; issuance, and publication on its website. Certified of this Order shall be registered with the Office of the National Administrative Register (ONAR) at the University of the copies
